task: Audit the mobile codebase to list all React Native components in use
Audit the web codebase to list all legacy web components
Document both lists in a shared format (spreadsheet or markdown table)
Identify overlap and components requiring adaptation or replacement
For each React Native component, check if a React Native Web equivalent exists
For components without equivalents, design a web-compatible version
Implement or adapt the component for web
Review and document the mapping and implementation status for each component
Identify all code locations where legacy web components are used
Replace each legacy component with the new/adapted React Native-based web component
Update all imports and references
Remove unused legacy component code
Commit changes incrementally for traceability
Identify logic and styles shared between mobile and web
Refactor code to maximize reuse (e.g., move to shared modules)
Implement platform-specific checks or files where needed
Test for regressions on both platforms after refactoring
List all new/adapted components requiring tests
Write or update unit tests for each component
Write or update integration tests for component interactions
Write or update end-to-end tests for user flows
Ensure visual regression tests are in place for UI consistency
Run all automated tests and fix any failures
Perform manual testing of all user flows on the web version
Test across multiple browsers and devices for compatibility
Document and triage any bugs or issues found
Iterate on fixes and retest as needed
Collect feedback from users and stakeholders on the new web components
Prioritize and address reported bugs or UX issues
Validate fixes with additional testing
Finalize documentation for the new component system
Announce completion and deprecate legacy components officially
